abstract.t: This document gives information on an RTCP Packet Type and RTCP XR Block Type including associated SDP parameters for Inter-Destination Media Synchronization (IDMS). The RTCP XR Block Type, registered with IANA based on an ETSI specification, is used to collect media playout information from participants in a group playing-out (watching, listening, etc.) a specific RTP media stream. The RTCP packet type specified by this document is used to distribute a common target playout point to which all the distributed receivers, sharing a media experience, can synchronize. Typical use cases in which IDMS is usefull are social TV, shared service control (i.e. applications where two or more geographically separated users are watching a media stream together), distance learning, networked video walls, networked loudspeakers, etc.
